name: abnormal-security
label: Abnormal Security
description: Abnormal Security helps to prevent email and email-like attacks, automate your security operations and reduce your total spend with one extensible platform.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Specify the URL of the Abnormal Security server to connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Access Token
fields.name: access_token
fields.description: Specify the access token used to access the Abnormal Security server to connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Get Threats
operations.description: Retrieves detailed list of threats based on the source, sender, and other filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Specify the criteria to filter the threats received. Currently, the only key that Abnormal Security supports is receivedTime. Specify gte (greater than or equal to) or lte (less than or equal to), with a datetime string in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format. For example, receivedTime gte 2020-01-01T01:01:01Z lte 2021-12-01T01:01:01Z.
parameters.description: Specify the criteria to filter the threats received. Currently, the only key that Abnormal Security supports is receivedTime. Specify gte (greater than or equal to) or lte (less than or equal to), with a datetime string in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format. For example, receivedTime gte 2020-01-01T01:01:01Z lte 2021-12-01T01:01:01Z.

parameters.title: Source
parameters.name: source
parameters.tooltip: Select a criteria to filter threats based on the source of detection. You can select one of the following options: All Advanced Default is All.
parameters.description: Select a criteria to filter threats based on the source of detection. You can select one of the following options: All Advanced Default is All.

parameters.title: Sender
parameters.name: sender
parameters.tooltip: Specify a name or an email address of the sender to filter threats.
parameters.description: Specify a name or an email address of the sender to filter threats.

parameters.title: Recipient
parameters.name: recipient
parameters.tooltip: Specify a name or an email address of the recipient to filter threats.
parameters.description: Specify a name or an email address of the recipient to filter threats.

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.name: subject
parameters.tooltip: Specify an email subject to filter threats.
parameters.description: Specify an email subject to filter threats.

parameters.title: Topic
parameters.name: topic
parameters.tooltip: Select the topic of email contents to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Billing Account Update Covid-19 Related Attack Cryptocurrency Invoice Invoice Inquiry
parameters.description: Select the topic of email contents to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Billing Account Update Covid-19 Related Attack Cryptocurrency Invoice Invoice Inquiry

parameters.title: Attack Type
parameters.name: attackType
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of attack to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Internal-to-Internal Attacks (Email Account Takeover) Spam Reconnaissance Scam Social Engineering (BEC) Phishing: Credential Invoice/Payment Fraud (BEC) Malware Extortion Phishing: Sensitive Data Other
parameters.description: Select the type of attack to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Internal-to-Internal Attacks (Email Account Takeover) Spam Reconnaissance Scam Social Engineering (BEC) Phishing: Credential Invoice/Payment Fraud (BEC) Malware Extortion Phishing: Sensitive Data Other

parameters.title: Attack Vector
parameters.name: attackVector
parameters.tooltip: Select the attack vector to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Link Attachment Text Others Attachment with Zipped File
parameters.description: Select the attack vector to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Link Attachment Text Others Attachment with Zipped File

parameters.title: Attack Strategy
parameters.name: attackStrategy
parameters.tooltip: Select the attack strategy to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Name Impersonation Internal Compromised Email Account External Compromised Email Account Spoofed Email Unknown Sender Covid 19 Related Attack
parameters.description: Select the attack strategy to filter threats. You can select from the following options: Name Impersonation Internal Compromised Email Account External Compromised Email Account Spoofed Email Unknown Sender Covid 19 Related Attack

parameters.title: Impersonated Party
parameters.name: impersonatedParty
parameters.tooltip: Select the impersonated party to filter threats. You can select from the following options: VIP Assistants Employee (other) Brand Known Partners Automated System (Internal) Automated System (External) Unknown Partner None / Others
parameters.description: Select the impersonated party to filter threats. You can select from the following options: VIP Assistants Employee (other) Brand Known Partners Automated System (Internal) Automated System (External) Unknown Partner None / Others

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results to return on each page. This parameter is ignored if the Filter parameter is blank. The minimum acceptable value is 1 and the default is 100.
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return on each page. This parameter is ignored if the Filter parameter is blank. The minimum acceptable value is 1 and the default is 100.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.tooltip: Specify a 1-indexed page number (page numbers start from 1 instead of 0) to get a particular page of results. This parameter is ignored if the Filter parameter is blank. The minimum acceptable value is 1.
parameters.description: Specify a 1-indexed page number (page numbers start from 1 instead of 0) to get a particular page of results. This parameter is ignored if the Filter parameter is blank. The minimum acceptable value is 1.

operations.title: Get Threat Details
operations.description: Retrieves details of threat based on the threat ID, pagination, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.name: threatId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the UUID of the threat whose details you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the UUID of the threat whose details you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.tooltip: (Currently ignored by Abnormal Security) Specify the number of messages corresponding to the specified ID in each page. Only 10 messages are displayed. Support is planned for a future version. Total results returned cannot exceed 10000 due to database limitations. Default value is 100.
parameters.description: (Currently ignored by Abnormal Security) Specify the number of messages corresponding to the specified ID in each page. Only 10 messages are displayed. Support is planned for a future version. Total results returned cannot exceed 10000 due to database limitations. Default value is 100.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.tooltip: (Currently ignored by Abnormal Security) Specify the 1-indexed page number (page numbers start from 1 instead of 0) to get a particular page of results. Only 10 messages are displayed. Support is planned for a future version. Total results returned cannot exceed 10000 due to database limitations. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Currently ignored by Abnormal Security) Specify the 1-indexed page number (page numbers start from 1 instead of 0) to get a particular page of results. Only 10 messages are displayed. Support is planned for a future version. Total results returned cannot exceed 10000 due to database limitations. Default value is 1.

parameters.description: Specify the UUID of the threat whose links you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.

operations.title: Get Cases
operations.description: Retrieves a list of Abnormal cases identified by Abnormal Security based on the filter criteria, pagination, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter. At least 1 of gte/lte must be specified, with a datetime string following the YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format.
parameters.description: Specify the filter. At least 1 of gte/lte must be specified, with a datetime string following the YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format.

parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return on each page. This parameter is ignored if the Filter parameter is blank. The minimum acceptable value is 1 and the default is 100.

parameters.description: Specify a 1-indexed page number (page numbers start from 1 instead of 0) to get a particular page of results. This parameter is ignored if the Filter parameter is blank. The minimum acceptable value is 1.

parameters.title: Message ID
parameters.name: messageId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ABX Message ID of the message whose details you want to retrieve from Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the ABX Message ID of the message whose details you want to retrieve from Abnormal Security server.

operations.title: Get Abuse Campaigns
operations.description: Retrieves a list of campaigns submitted to Abuse Mailbox based on the source, sender, and other filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Specify the criteria to filter the threats received. Currently, the only key that Abnormal Security supports is lastReportedTime￼<![if !supportAnnotations]>[OK1]<![endif]> <![if !supportAnnotations]>[AS2]<![endif]> ￼Specify gte (greater than or equal to) or lte (less than or equal to), with a datetime string in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format. operations.title: Get Detection Reports
operations.description: Retrieves a list of Detection 360° reports that you have submitted and displays details for each case, including report summaries, statuses, and message analyses based on the inquiry type, report duration, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Inquiry Type
parameters.name: inquiry_type
parameters.tooltip: Select the inquiry type to fetch detection reports from the Abnormal Security server. You can select from the following options: Missed Attacks False Positives
parameters.description: Select the inquiry type to fetch detection reports from the Abnormal Security server. You can select from the following options: Missed Attacks False Positives

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start of the datetime range, as an RFC 3339 timestamp, to fetch Detection 360° cases. Defaults to 30 days before the end datetime.
parameters.description: Specify the start of the datetime range, as an RFC 3339 timestamp, to fetch Detection 360° cases. Defaults to 30 days before the end datetime.

parameters.title: End
parameters.name: end
parameters.tooltip: The end of the datetime range, as an RFC 3339 timestamp, to fetch Detection 360° cases. Defaults to the current datetime.
parameters.description: The end of the datetime range, as an RFC 3339 timestamp, to fetch Detection 360° cases. Defaults to the current datetime.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Select the statuses to fetch detection reports from the Abnormal Security server. You can select one or more options from the following: Unreviewed Containing Attack Improving Platform Resolved Correcting Judgement Defaults to all statuses.
parameters.description: Select the statuses to fetch detection reports from the Abnormal Security server. You can select one or more options from the following: Unreviewed Containing Attack Improving Platform Resolved Correcting Judgement Defaults to all statuses.

operations.title: Check Case Action Status
operations.description: Checks the status of an action requested on a case based on the case ID, action ID, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Case ID
parameters.name: caseId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the case ID whose case action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the case ID whose case action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.

parameters.title: Action ID
parameters.name: actionId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the UUID representing the action ID whose case action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the UUID representing the action ID whose case action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

operations.title: Check Threat Action Status
operations.description: Checks the status of an action requested on a threat based on the threat ID, action ID, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.name: threatId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the UUID of the threat whose action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the UUID of the threat whose action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.

parameters.title: Action ID
parameters.name: actionId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the UUID representing the action ID for a threat whose action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the UUID representing the action ID for a threat whose action status you want to retrieve from the Abnormal Security server.

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

operations.title: Download Data from Threat Log
operations.description: Downloads data from threat Log in CSV format based on the received date, source, and other filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Specify the criteria to filter the threats log. Currently, the only key that Abnormal Security supports is receivedTime. Specify a datetime string in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format. Range is limited to 14 days.
parameters.description: Specify the criteria to filter the threats log. Currently, the only key that Abnormal Security supports is receivedTime. Specify a datetime string in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ format. Range is limited to 14 days.

parameters.title: Source
parameters.name: source
parameters.tooltip: Select a criteria to filter threats based on the source of detection. You can select one of the following options: All Advanced Default is All.
parameters.description: Select a criteria to filter threats based on the source of detection. You can select one of the following options: All Advanced Default is All.

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

operations.title: Manage Threat
operations.description: Manages and initiates action on a threat identified by Abnormal Security based on the threat ID, action, and other input parameters that you have specified. Use this to remediate or un-remediate a threat.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.name: threatId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the UUID of the threat on which to take the selected action.
parameters.description: Specify the UUID of the threat on which to take the selected action.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.tooltip: Specify the action to perform on a threat. The action to be performed is sent in a JSON format. For example: { "action": "remediate" }
parameters.description: Specify the action to perform on a threat. The action to be performed is sent in a JSON format. For example: { "action": "remediate" }

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

operations.title: Manage Abnormal Case
operations.description: Manages and initiates action on an Abnormal case based on the case ID, action, and other input parameters that you have specified. Use this to acknowledge or take another remediation action on a case.

parameters.title: Case ID
parameters.name: caseId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the case ID on which to take the selected action.
parameters.description: Specify the case ID on which to take the selected action.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.tooltip: Specify the action to perform on a case. The action to be performed is sent in a JSON format.

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

operations.title: Get Case Analysis
operations.description: Provides the analysis and timeline details of a case based on the case ID and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Case ID
parameters.name: caseId
parameters.tooltip: Specify the case ID on which to get the analysis from the Abnormal Security server.
parameters.description: Specify the case ID on which to get the analysis from the Abnormal Security server.

parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.

operations.title: Submit a Missed Attack or False Positive Report
operations.description: Submits a missed attack or a false positive judgement by Abnormal Security based on the false positive report data and other input parameters that you have specified. Abnormal Security uses this data to improve their models and gives customers transparency into the frequency of missed attacks and false positives.

parameters.title: False Positive Report Data
parameters.name: report_data
parameters.tooltip: Specify the missed attack or false positive report data. The report body is sent in a JSON format. For example: { "description": "Alice reported this email was missing from their inbox.", "portal_link": "https://portal.abnormalsecurity.com/home/threat-center/remediation-history/1234567890", "report_type": "false-positive", "received_date": "2020/02/01" }
parameters.description: Specify the missed attack or false positive report data. The report body is sent in a JSON format. For example: { "description": "Alice reported this email was missing from their inbox.", "portal_link": "https://portal.abnormalsecurity.com/home/threat-center/remediation-history/1234567890", "report_type": "false-positive", "received_date": "2020/02/01" }

value.description: Alice reported this email was missing from their inbox.

parameters.title: Mock Data
parameters.name: mock-data
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
parameters.description: Select this option to return test data instead real-world data. By default, this option is not selected, i.e., it is set to false.
